7973075212bc.bio: Top Medium writer in sports, TV, humor, NFL, NBA. Words at Cauldron, 16 Wins Ring, Sports Pickle, Bleacher Report, Hoop NBA, and others @wheatonbrando

1a7d62880546.bio: Truehoop Network Member. Editor for http://t.co/ttEWPRI8BK & http://t.co/GMskSvJCjG, formerly of The Two Man Game. TV. Movies. Video Games. My dog, Grace.

3084a5935f4e.bio: Kyle Baller, Enthusiast at Large. A research scientist working in the Baltimore Washington DC area with a general interest in sports, culture and politics.

paragraphs.name: 02ac
paragraphs.text: Sportswriters have been awakened by Donald Trump’s presidency. Is that what their readers want?

paragraphs.name: 02ac
paragraphs.text: Sportswriters have been awakened by Donald Trump’s presidency. Is that what their readers want?

73398713c76.title: No mention of Sage Steele here?

paragraphs.name: 0e69
paragraphs.text: No mention of Sage Steele here? Or Schilling? or the Gophers football team? Or is *that* kind of political speech not acceptable?

80fec8c89ba4.title: I’m of the camp that says “let my sports be sports, and my politics be politics.”

paragraphs.name: 9ad6
paragraphs.text: I’m of the camp that says “let my sports be sports, and my politics be politics.” I don’t want them mixed. I don’t mind of a sports writer has political views/articles…but I don’t want them in my SI, my ESPN the Mag, etc…just like I don’t watch Fox News, CNN, MSNBC or any other news program to get sports info.

46cf51a510d3.title: Then they shouldn’t get offended and block every person who responds with a different opinion.

paragraphs.name: 317e
paragraphs.text: Then they shouldn’t get offended and block every person who responds with a different opinion. Half the country voted Trump.

virtuals.subtitle: I’ve never once said “stick to sports”, but I just wonder how they’d feel if the roles were reversed and they had to listen to my political…

15eeffc710cf.title: This is a legitimate question that I have about this.

content.subtitle: I’ve never once said “stick to sports”, but I just wonder how they’d feel if the roles were reversed and they had to listen to my political…

paragraphs.name: c9e6
paragraphs.text: This is a legitimate question that I have about this. I disagree (strongly) politically with most of the sports writers I follow on twitter and social media. After 8 years of not paying attention to a single thing Barack Obama did besides doing interviews they found amusing, they’ve now made it their mission to become political activists. What am I…

14955b4077e9.title: I come to sports sites to escape politics.

paragraphs.name: 5ea0
paragraphs.text: I come to sports sites to escape politics.

65aa1a58565.title: I care more about writers putting out a quality product, than having my viewpoint catered to.

paragraphs.name: b88e
paragraphs.text: I care more about writers putting out a quality product, than having my viewpoint catered to. Write about whatever the hell you want, just make it interesting

virtuals.subtitle: Look, you basically got every prediction wrong leading up to this election. You looked at the data, and came the wrong conclusion as to who…

d79d02ea3b9.title: Bryan — the reason why sports writers shouldn’t talk about politics is because they don’t know…

content.subtitle: Look, you basically got every prediction wrong leading up to this election. You looked at the data, and came the wrong conclusion as to who…

paragraphs.name: dbfe
paragraphs.text: Bryan — the reason why sports writers shouldn’t talk about politics is because they don’t know anything about Politics. Should economists start reviewing movies? Should the lifestyle magazine editor tell you where to invest your money?

paragraphs.name: b42d
paragraphs.text: Look, you basically got every prediction wrong leading up to this election. You looked at…

virtuals.subtitle: I say ‘stick to sports’ when I am being force-fed one political ideology. If there is a particular issue that comes up, and it makes its…

7d38581505d.title: The issue with this, as others have written here, is that these views don’t come up unless it is a…

content.subtitle: I say ‘stick to sports’ when I am being force-fed one political ideology. If there is a particular issue that comes up, and it makes its…

paragraphs.name: ad8c
paragraphs.text: The issue with this, as others have written here, is that these views don’t come up unless it is a Republican-related issue or candidate. Where were the subtle jabs about the Democratic primary being rigged? Where were the tie-ins to some small businesses being ruined by the Affordable Care Act? Where were the comments about President Obama stumping…

paragraphs.name: 42cf
paragraphs.text: No! God, no! F*** no!!! We read articles from sportswriters because we want to read about sports. It’s a terrible feeling when you wake up, make some coffee, get online to read some basketball or football stories, and instead you get a political diatribe. Whether the writer is in line with your own views or not, people don’t want their sports fix…

f9764aa5f954.title: It might just be who I follow, but it seems to me that every sports writer that I see including…

paragraphs.name: 7fe8
paragraphs.text: It might just be who I follow, but it seems to me that every sports writer that I see including politics in their writing are left-wing/progressive. I am curious what percentatge of writers that “don’t stick to sports” are Democrats/Progressives and what percentage are Republican/Conservatives and what percentage are moderates/libertarians. Someone should study this and put out an article.

f9eb3e244a04.title: Chance that the people bitching to these human beings that they should “stick to sports” are the…

paragraphs.name: 7b96
paragraphs.text: Chance that the people bitching to these human beings that they should “stick to sports” are the very same people who voted for Trump = 99.7%…

virtuals.metaDescription: Sportswriters have been awakened by Donald Trump’s presidency. But not all readers want their sports coverage to be politicized.

paragraphs.name: 4cf8
paragraphs.text: The End of “Stick to Sports”

paragraphs.name: 02ac
paragraphs.text: Sportswriters have been awakened by Donald Trump’s presidency. Is that…

paragraphs.name: 88ff
paragraphs.text: No.

paragraphs.name: 6deb
paragraphs.text: Yes. Yes it is.

22cd6e1e2e3c.title: I for one am very grateful to see so many writers (and others in sports industry) use their…

paragraphs.text: I for one am very grateful to see so many writers (and others in sports industry) use their platform to speak up for what they believe matters. It’s impossible to #sticktosports when they seem so irrelevant next to bigger things at stake in the world.

e77ac0a67384.title: I’m fine with sports writers, entertainment writers, any other non political media person using…

paragraphs.name: 5ee5
paragraphs.text: I’m fine with sports writers, entertainment writers, any other non political media person using their twitter accounts and media platforms to talk about politics. Doesn’t bother me one bit. The only thing I ask is that they don’t blend the two into the same piece. Over the last year, there’s been several times where I’m reading a column (happens more…

virtuals.subtitle: When looking around to see what Steve Kerr thought about the Warrior’s performance, that is relegated behind his thoughts on whatever…

94828e07440c.title: I think sticking to sports is boring, but the politicization of nearly everything can grow tiresome…

content.subtitle: When looking around to see what Steve Kerr thought about the Warrior’s performance, that is relegated behind his thoughts on whatever…

paragraphs.name: 0c34
paragraphs.text: I think sticking to sports is boring, but the politicization of nearly everything can grow tiresome after a while.

paragraphs.name: bfb9
paragraphs.text: When looking around to see what Steve Kerr thought about the Warrior’s performance, that is relegated behind his thoughts on whatever asinine thing Trump did or said. I, personally, want to know both things. The…

virtuals.subtitle: In a free country it is everybody’s responsibility to discuss politics and try to become the most aware they can be of what is best for our…

be3ba66873a8.title: They are still journalists with training, experience and knowledge.

content.subtitle: In a free country it is everybody’s responsibility to discuss politics and try to become the most aware they can be of what is best for our…

paragraphs.name: a6e9
paragraphs.text: They are still journalists with training, experience and knowledge. If they are finding it necessary to risk their cushy, well-compensated jobs it’s for a good reason. To silence them would be to diminish our ability to evaluate our politicians and vote rationally. Hide your head in the sand if you wish, but don’t shame those who aren’t as cowardly…

5daa9e630b23.title: So a couple of hundred people stranded at airports this past weekend greatly motivated you to…

paragraphs.name: 6ca2
paragraphs.text: So a couple of hundred people stranded at airports this past weekend greatly motivated you to question whether sportswriters should just stick to sports. But when 500,000 Syrians were slaughtered these past 4 years under the Obama administrations foreign policy, you did not feel a motivated. I guess 100 people being inconvenienced at airports is a lot worse than 500,000 Syrians dying.

e0c1d21cc56.title: Bryan, I doubt you will read this because each of your political articles are filled with such…

paragraphs.name: 9b7d
paragraphs.text: Bryan, I doubt you will read this because each of your political articles are filled with such vileness but I want to tell you that your writing about politics since this site launched has been some of my favorite political writing. Please keep it up.

paragraphs.name: f737
paragraphs.text: No

40e6aa74486a.title: Is it impossible to keep politics out of everything?

paragraphs.name: 2a6e
paragraphs.text: Is it impossible to keep politics out of everything? I love sports as an escape. It’s a place where, on that day/night, the best team wins.

1811a848d1fc.title: Trump is the only important thing going on right now.

paragraphs.text: Trump is the only important thing going on right now. Sports is irrelevant in that context. Sports is only entertainment, don’t ever forget that.

virtuals.subtitle: I for one would much rather we did stick to sports. I can’t even look at Facebook anymore without a nonstop barrage of pro-liberal/anti…

40ca060703d3.title: ESPN will let their personalities rip on Trump all they want (which is fine), but I don’t like the…

content.subtitle: I for one would much rather we did stick to sports. I can’t even look at Facebook anymore without a nonstop barrage of pro-liberal/anti…

paragraphs.name: 6ee9
paragraphs.text: ESPN will let their personalities rip on Trump all they want (which is fine), but I don’t like the hypocrisy of disciplining Schilling for doing the same.

paragraphs.name: 4cec
paragraphs.text: I for one would much rather we did stick to sports. I can’t even look at Facebook anymore without a nonstop barrage of pro-liberal/anti-Trump posts.

80ad265d762f.title: I don’t mind your premise, and I don’t mind politics in sports, to a degree.

paragraphs.name: 96d0
paragraphs.text: I don’t mind your premise, and I don’t mind politics in sports, to a degree. I find something interesting about you saying at the end that there’s 53.9% of America that didn’t vote for Trump to draw from as an audience, and of course that’s true. It does seem a bit disingenuous to say “fuck the 46.1% who did; I won’t even write a neutral piece to try…

virtuals.subtitle: Pretending that the salary cap, or the draft, or “Joe Schmo’s training camp holdout is greedy/selfish,” or amateurism in the NCAA, etc. etc…

d7a3465223d9.title: “Keep sports separate from politics” is, and has always been, a political statement.

content.subtitle: Pretending that the salary cap, or the draft, or “Joe Schmo’s training camp holdout is greedy/selfish,” or amateurism in the NCAA, etc. etc…

paragraphs.name: d4a9
paragraphs.text: “Keep sports separate from politics” is, and has always been, a political statement.

paragraphs.name: ab25
paragraphs.text: Pretending that the salary cap, or the draft, or “Joe Schmo’s training camp holdout is greedy/selfish,” or amateurism in the NCAA, etc. etc. etc. are somehow devoid of politics, is just that: pretending.
